title: Great
text: I just ordered some food from a restaurant and I really liked it. I had received a notification to rate my order from the restaurant which I dismissed when I was in a hurry. Now I want to go back and rate my order/the restaurant because the food turned out great, but there is no option to do this. I look through both the Uber app (I primarily use this) and the UberEats app for this and it seems that neither let you do so. I hope you can add a feature that lets me do this for food I ordered in the past.

title: The Best
text: Uber is the best! Lyft is not the best.

title: Uber fraud resolution is incompetent
text:
I had over $300 of fares charged to my account in a single day in a country that I have never been to and is thousands of miles away from where I live. I have never shared the account and do not know anyone in the country where the fares were accrued.

In spite of this, and the fact that I have never spent more than $60 in a single day on rideshares, Uber claimed that the pick up and drop off points were consistent with my previous history. All of the trips on this day were the only trips ever charged to my account in that specific country.

My bank was easily able to see that I could not have been there.

Use Lyft.

title: Safe Driving
text: While on the freeway, enjoying the ride. A very large truck hauling cars attempted to come into our lane. We came very close to colliding. But my driver, skilled driver that he is avoided the collision and we both were kind of scared. It took us both a moment to collect ourselves and continued safely bringing me home. I would definitely request Mario again.

title: Don‚Äôt get scammed!
text: Got charged for a ride I never got because the driver went to the wrong place. You can see the entire route the minute the ride is confirmed. So of course I messaged him and asked why it would say he‚Äôs here when he is not. He lied told me I put in the wrong address and then proceeded to complete the trip with no one in the vehicle in order to still charge me. Uber is refusing a refund even though I have proof I didn‚Äôt put the wrong address. So yes don‚Äôt do Uber do Lyft or your local cabs.

title: Dirty Cars
text: If there is a way to give feedback to Uber about their service in general without blaming specific drivers, I can't find it. There's no use submitting dozens of complaints, it's simple: Uber clearly does not have its drivers submit images of their cars to prove cleanliness like a rental car app would, it's not hard. With all the surveillance, they could do that. Uber could encourage drivers to roll down the windows between rides or otherwise air out their breath and body odor before a new person gets in. Simple things that are not being done, and we're all paying way too much for these 1980s standards. I've literally gotten sick from sick drivers working while sick and sneezing while unmasked. I don't care if it's "just a cold" that is unprofessional. So disgusting. I'll add that Uber has ruined my plans and appointments by allowing drivers to cancel when they are finally just 2 minutes away after waiting for over 10. For now we have two options, Uber and Lyft. Seems they are both taking advantage of that.

title: Fees charges
